topic.title: Component Dependencies View for NVDL Schemas

body.p: The Component Dependencies view allows you to see the dependencies for a selected NVDL named mode.

If you want to see the dependencies of an NVDL mode, select the desired component in the editor and choose the Component Dependencies action from the contextual menu. The action is available for all named modes.

body.p: In the Component Dependencies the following actions are available on the toolbar:

dlentry.dd: Allows you to stop the dependencies computing.

Allows you to configure a search scope to compute the dependencies structure. If you decide to set the application to use automatically the defined scope for future operations, select the corresponding checkbox.

body.p: The following actions are available in the contextual menu:

dlentry.dd: Selects the first reference of the referenced component from the current selected component in the dependencies tree.
Shows the definition of the current selected component in the dependencies tree.

body.note: If a component contains multiple references to another component, a small table containing all references is displayed. When a recursive reference is encountered it is marked with a special icon .
